python usage : nb_nodes = mecaMAILx_GetNbNodes(ibdyty)
ivalue
(integer) : id of the mecaMAILx

briefdescription.para: Get the number of elements of a mecaMAILx.

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : nb_elements = mecaMAILx_GetNbElements(ibdyty)
ivalue
(integer) : id of the mecaMAILx
nb_nodes (integer) : number of elements of a mecaMAILx

briefdescription.para: Get the number of Gauss points of an element of a mecaMAILx.

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : nb_gp = mecaMAILx_GetNbElements(ibdyty, iblmty)
ibdyty
(integer) : id of the mecaMAILx
iblmty
(integer) : id of the element
nb_gp (integer) : number of Gauss point of an element of a mecaMAILx

briefdescription.para: ask for precomputation of the W matrix on support node dofs of contactors for one body. Assumes bulk behaviour is linear.

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : mecaMAILx_SetPreconBody(ivalue)
ivalue
(integer) : id of body to set precon

briefdescription.para: ask for precomputation of the W matrix on support node dofs of contactors for all bodies. Assumes bulk behaviour is linear.

detaileddescription.para: python usage : mecaMAILx_SetPreconAllBodies()

briefdescription.para: compute the precon W on precon bodies

detaileddescription.para: python usage : mecaMAILx_ComputePreconW()

briefdescription.para: initialize an empty precon W

detaileddescription.para: python usage : mecaMAILx_InitPreconW()

memberdef.argsstring: (int ivalue1, int ivalue2, int ivalue3, double *rvector_in, int rlength_in)
memberdef.name: mecaMAILx_PutPreconW

briefdescription.para: push a column of precon W

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : mecaMAILx_PutPreconW(ivalue1, ivalue2, ivalue3, vect)
ivalue1
(integer) : body number
ivalue2
(integer) : node number
ivalue3
(integer) : dof number
vect
(double) : column

briefdescription.para: Get the list of preconditionned nodes of a mecaMAILx body.

detaileddescription.para: Here memory is allocated within lmgc90 so that the pointer can be freely modified by third parties without nasty effect on lmgc90 functioning.

python usage : precon_list = mecaMAILx_GetNodesPrecon(ibdyty)
ibdyty
(integer) : index of the desired mecaMAILx
precon_list (integer list) : list of the preconditionned nodes

briefdescription.para: ask for corotationnal computation of the W matrix. Assumes bulk behaviour is linear.

detaileddescription.para: python usage : mecaMAILx_SetCoroAllBodies()

briefdescription.para: ask for corotationnal computation of the W matrix of a given body. Assumes bulk behaviour is linear.

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : mecaMAILx_SetCoroBody(ivalue)
ivalue
(integer) : id of body to set coro

briefdescription.para: set the admssible tolerance on rigid body velocity computed by deformable model

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : mecaMAILx_SetTolCoro(tol)
tol
(double) : tolerance

briefdescription.para: ask for rigid computation of the W matrix. Assumes bulk behaviour is linear.

python usage : mecaMAILx_SetRigidBody(ivalue)

(integer) : id of body to compute as a rigid

briefdescription.para: avoid deformable part computation of a deformable body declared as rigid

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : mecaMAILx_SkipDeformableComputationBody(ivalue)
ivalue
(integer) : id of body to compute without deformation

briefdescription.para: computes internal matrices for rigid description

detaileddescription.para: python usage : mecaMAILx_BuildRigidBodies()

briefdescription.para: return 1 if a given body is rigid/coro, 0 otherwize

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : rigid = mecaMAILx_IsRigid(ibdyty)
idbdy(integer)
: id of the body we want visibility
rigid (integer) : 1 if body is visible, 0 otherwize

briefdescription.para: return an inertia frame matrix

detaileddescription.para: Possible values for datatype field are "RFbeg", "RF___", "RFTT_ (stands for Rigid Frame)

python usage : mat = mecaMAILx_GetRigidFrame(datatype, ibdyty)
idbdy(integer)
: id of the body
vec (float matrix) : frame matrix (beg, current or TT)

briefdescription.para: return TT center of inertia coordinates

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : vec = mecaMAILx_GetRigidCoorTT(ibdyty)
idbdy(integer)
: id of the body
vec (float vector) : TT center of inertia coordinates

briefdescription.para: return ref center of inertia coordinates

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : vec = mecaMAILx_GetRigidCooref(ibdyty)
idbdy(integer)
: id of the body
vec (float vector) : ref center of inertia coordinates

briefdescription.para: declares rigid velocity dof as driven

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : mecaMAILx_SetRVDrivenDofs(idbody,vector_in)
idbody
(integer) : id of the body
vector
(integer) : list of driven dofs

briefdescription.para: set the value of rigid velocity dof value

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : mecaMAILx_SetRVDrivenDofValue(idbody,iddof,rv)
idbody
(integer) : id of the body
iddof
(integer) : id of dof
rv
(float) : value

briefdescription.para: Set a vector of a coro or rigid mecaMAILx body.

detaileddescription.para:
Possible values for datatype field are:
"Coor0": reference coordinates
"Xbeg_": cumulated displacements over time at beginning of time step
"X____": cumulated displacements over time in computed configuration
"Vbeg_": velocity at beginning of time step
"V____": velocity in computed configuration
"Vfree": velocity free of contacts
"Reac_": contact reaction force
"Raux_": working array for reaction force
"Ireac": contact impulse
"Iaux_": working array for impulste
"Fext_": external forces
uses copy, and in case fo Fext, the operation is not just setting but adding

python usage : mecaMAILx_PutBodyRVector(datatype, ibdyty, vector)
datatype
(string [5]) : the vector to set
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of the RBDY3
vector
(double array) : the new value of the vector

briefdescription.para: Get a copy of a vector of a mecaMAILx body.

detaileddescription.para:
Possible values for datatype field are:
"Coor0": reference coordinates
"Coorb": coordinates at beginning of time step
"Xbeg_": cumulated displacements over time at beginning of time step
"XTT__": cumulated displacements over time in detection configuration
"X____": cumulated displacements over time in computed configuration
"V____": velocity in computed configuration
"Vbeg_": velocity at beginning of time step
"Vfree": velocity free of contacts
"Reac_": contact reaction force
"Raux_": working array for reaction force
"Ireac": contact impulse
"Iaux_": working array for impulste
"Fext_": external forces
"Fint_": internal forces

python usage : vector = mecaMAILx_GetBodyRVector(datatype, ibdyty)
datatype
(string [5]) : the vector to get
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of the RBDY3
vector (double array) : output vector

memberdef.argsstring: (char *cvalue1_c, int ivalue1, double *matrix_in, int dim1, int dim2)
memberdef.name: mecaMAILx_PutBodyVector

briefdescription.para: Set a vector of a given body.

detaileddescription.para:
Possible values for datatype field are:
"Coor0": reference coordinates
"Coor_": coordinates in computed configuration
"Coorb": coordinates at beginning of time step
"X____": cumulated displacements over time in computed configuration
"Xbeg_": cumulated displacements over time at beginning of time step
"V____": velocity in computed configuration
"Vbeg_": velocity at beginning of time step
"Vfree": velocity free of contacts
"Reac_": contact reaction force
"Raux_": working array for reaction force
"Ireac": contact impulse
"Iaux_": working array for impulste
"Fext_": external forces
"Fint_": internal forces

python usage : mecaMAILx_PutBodyVector(datatype, ibdyty, matrix)
datatype
(string of size 5) : the vector to set
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of body
matrix
(double array) : the new value

briefdescription.para: Get a copy of a vector of a given body.

detaileddescription.para:
Possible values for datatype field are:
"Coor0": reference coordinates
"Coor_": coordinates in computed configuration
"Coorb": coordinates at beginning of time step
"X____": cumulated displacements over time in computed configuration
"Xbeg_": cumulated displacements over time at beginning of time step
"V____": velocity in computed configuration
"Vbeg_": velocity at beginning of time step
"Vaux_": working array for velocity
"Vfree": velocity free of contacts
"Reac_": contact reaction force
"Raux_": working array for reaction force
"Ireac": contact impulse
"Iaux_": working array for impulste
"Fext_": external forces
"Fint_": internal forces

Python usage : vector = mecaMAILx_GetBodyVector(datatype, ibdyty)
datatype
(string of size 5) : the vector to get
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of considered body
vector (double 2D-array) : the desired data

briefdescription.para: Get a copy of a the elements' material vector of a given body.

detaileddescription.para:
Python usage : materials = mecaMAILx_GetMaterials(ibdyty)
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of considered body
vector (double 1D-array) : the material index of elements

briefdescription.para: Get a copy of the smoothed nodal stress (Cauchy) of a given body: 2D Sxx,Syy,Sxy,Szz,Svm | 3D Sxx,Sxy,Syy,Sxz,Syz,Szz,Svm.

detaileddescription.para:
Python usage : stress = mecaMAILx_GetStress(ibdyty)
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of considered body
stress (double 2D-array) : nodal stress of the desired body

briefdescription.para: Get a copy of the smoothed nodal strain (Almansi) of a given body: 2D Exx,Eyy,Exy,Ezz,J | 3D Exx,Exy,Eyy,Exz,Eyz,Ezz,J.

detaileddescription.para:
Python usage : strain = mecaMAILx_GetStrain(ibdyty)
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of considered body
strain (double 2D-array) : nodal strain of the desired body

briefdescription.para: Get a copy of the smoothed nodal internal variables (2D:10 ; 3D:57)

detaileddescription.para:
Python usage : strain = mecaMAILx_GetInternalVariables(ibdyty)
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of considered body
strain (double 2D-array) : nodal internal variables of the desired body

briefdescription.para: Get a copy of the mean stress (Cauchy) of a given body: 2D Sxx,Syy,Sxy,Szz,Svm | 3D Sxx,Sxy,Syy,Sxz,Syz,Szz,Svm.

detaileddescription.para:
Python usage : stress = mecaMAILx_GetElementStress(ibdyty)
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of considered body
stress (double 2D-array) : nodal stress of the desired body

briefdescription.para: Check if the bodies riches an equilibrium state (velocities almost equal to 0)

detaileddescription.para: python usage : iconv = mecaMAILx_CheckEquilibriumState()

simplesect.para: iconv (boolean) : True if in equilibrium state

briefdescription.para: set the norm for CheckEquilibriumState

detaileddescription.para:
Type of check test:
Qvlcy : quadratic norm of velocy
Maxm : maximum norm of velocy

python usage : mecaMAILx_SetEquilibriumNorm(checktype, tol)
checktype
(char[5]) : type of check test
tol
(double) : tolerance

briefdescription.para: Read DRV_DOF.DAT.

detaileddescription.para: python usage : mecaMAILx_ReadDrivenDof()

briefdescription.para: Read GPV file.

detaileddescription.para: If num <= 0 : DATBOX/GPV.INI file is read
Else : OUTBOX/GPV.OUT.num is read, num being the parameter used in TimeEvolution_ReadIniGPV last call

python usage : mecaMAILx_ReadIniGPV(num=0)
num
(integer) : which GPV file to read

briefdescription.para: Read DOF file.

detaileddescription.para: If num <= 0 : DATBOX/DOF.INI file is read
Else : OUTBOX/DOF.OUT.num is read, num being the parameter used in TimeEvolution_ReadIniDof last call

python usage : mecaMAILx_ReadIniDof(num=0)
num
(integer) : which DOF file to read

i_list

briefdescription.para: Get the rank of scalar field of an element of a body from its name.

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : f_rank = mecaMAILx_GetScalarFieldRank(ibdyty, iblmty, name)
ibdyty
(integer) : id of the concern body
iblmty
(integer) : id of the concern element
name
(string) : name of the desired field
f_rank (integer) : rank of the corresponding field

memberdef.argsstring: (int IdBody, int f_rank, double *rvector_in, int rlength_in)
memberdef.name: mecaMAILx_SetScalarFieldByNode

briefdescription.para: Update elementary scalar field through a nodal external field on a given body.

detaileddescription.para: Use the form functions of the elements and input values to compute and store field values at Gauss points.

python usage : mecaMAILx_SetScalarFieldByNode(IdBody, f_rank, f)
IdBody
(integer) : id of the concern body
f_rank
(integer) : rank of the field to set
f
(double array) : value of the field
You need to declare this field in your MODELS.DAT

memberdef.argsstring: (int IdBody, int f_rank, double *rvector_in, int rlength_in)
memberdef.name: mecaMAILx_SetScalarFieldByElement

briefdescription.para: Update elementary scalar field through a element external field on a given body.

detaileddescription.para: Field values are stored at Gauss point, on an element all Gauss point have the element value

python usage : mecaMAILx_SetScalarFieldByElement(IdBody, f_rank, f)
IdBody
(integer) : id of the concern body
f_rank
(integer) : rank of the field to set
f
(double array) : value of the field
You need to declare this field in your MODELS.DAT

briefdescription.para: Get the rank of field of an element of a body from its name.

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : f_rank = mecaMAILx_GetVectorFieldRank(ibdyty, iblmty, name)
ibdyty
(integer) : id of the concern body
iblmty
(integer) : id of the concern element
name
(string) : name of the desired vector field
f_rank (integer) : rank of the corresponding vector field

memberdef.argsstring: (int ibdyty, int f_rank, double *matrix_in, int dim1, int dim2)
memberdef.name: mecaMAILx_SetVectorFieldByNode

briefdescription.para: Update elementary fields through a nodal external field on a given body.

detaileddescription.para: Use the form functions of the elements and input values to compute and store field values at Gauss points.
You need to declare this field in your MODELS.DAT

python usage : mecaMAILx_SetVectorFieldByNode(IdBody, f_rank, f)
IdBody
(integer) : id of the concern body
f_rank
(integer) : rank of the vector field to set
f
(double array) : value of the vector field

memberdef.argsstring: (int ibdyty, int f_rank, double *matrix_in, int dim1, int dim2)
memberdef.name: mecaMAILx_SetVectorFieldByElement

briefdescription.para: Update elementary fields through a nodal external field on a given body.

detaileddescription.para: Use the form functions of the elements and input values to compute and store field values at Gauss points.
You need to declare this field in your MODELS.DAT

python usage : mecaMAILx_SetVectorFieldByElement(IdBody, f_rank, f)
IdBody
(integer) : id of the concern body
f_rank
(integer) : rank of the vector field to set
f
(double array) : value of the vector field

briefdescription.para: Stop job properly.

detaileddescription.para: python usage : mecaMAILx_Terminate()

briefdescription.para: Use user routine to compute the ortho frame of a list of bodies.

detaileddescription.para: This method uses a routine define by the user in user.f90

python usage : mecaMAILx_ComputeOrthoFrame(i_list)
i_list
(list of integer) : list of bodies to compute ortho frame with user routine if omitted works on all objects

briefdescription.para: Use user routine to compute a field at gp.

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : mecaMAILx_ComputeUserField(ifield, i_list)
ifield
(integer) : id of the field to compute
i_list
(list of integer) : list of bodies to compute user fields on if omitted works on all objects

python usage : mecaMAILx_SetVisible(ibdyty)
ibdyty(integer)
: index of the mecaMAILx

briefdescription.para: rended a given mecaMAILx invisible

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : mecaMAILx_SetInvisible(ibdyty)
ibdyty(integer)
: index of the mecaMAILx

briefdescription.para: return if a given body visible

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : visible = mecaMAILx_IsVisible(ibdyty)
idbdy(integer)
: id of the body we want visibility
visible (integer) : 1 if body is visible, 0 else

memberdef.argsstring: (double alpha, double beta, int *ivector_in=NULL, int ilength_in=0)
memberdef.name: mecaMAILx_ComputeRayleighDamping

briefdescription.para: compute the Rayleigh damping: C=alpha*M+beta*K of a list of bodies

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : mecaMAILx_ComputeRayleighDamping(alpha,beta,i_list)
alpha
(real) : damping value
beta
(real) : damping value
i_list
(list of integer) : list of bodies to compute Rayleigh damping if omitted works on all objects

python usage : mecaMAILx_ComputeRayleighDampingDiscreteElement(damp, i_list)
ref_size
(real) : damping value
i_list

briefdescription.para: return TT node coordinates

: id of the body

idbdy(integer)
: id of the body

: id of the node
vec (float vector) : ref node coordinates

briefdescription.para: Get a copy of a matrix of a given body.

detaileddescription.para: Possible values for datatype field are "mass_", "stiff", "damp_"

Python usage : matrix = mecaMAILx_GetBodyMatrix(datatype, ibdyty)
datatype
(string of size 5) : the matrix to get
ibdyty
(integer) : rank of considered body
matrix (double array) : the desired matrix

briefdescription.para: Get the driven dof of a body.

detaileddescription.para:
python usage : [drvdof_indices, drvdof_values] = mecaMAILx_getDrvVlocy(ibdyty)
ibdyty
(integer) : index of the mecaMAILx
drvdof_indices
(integer array) : indices list of driven dof
drvdof_values
(real array) : values of the driven dof

briefdescription.para: Compute the value of the driven velocity of a body a current time.

detaileddescription.para: In place replacement in the input array of the new value(s) of the driven velocity

python usage : mecaMAILx_computeDrvVlocy(ibdyty, values)
ibdyty
(integer) : index of the mecaMAILx
values
(double array) : numpy array, input old values of imposed velocity, output new ones

briefdescription.para: Apply Drv Dof on a given body.

IdBody
(integer) : id of the concern body
f_dof

f_node
(integer) : node
f_value
(double) : value of the drvdof
